reviews.text: Natilie Hotel, Torremolinos,Spain, Date 10/11/2007.
reviews.title: Treted like a Lord.

likes.liked: — Friendliness of staff, cleanliness and full of Spanish culture

reviews.title: Awful hotel, awful location. Don't go there.
reviews.text: As a solo visitor I really did'nt know what to expect from reading previous comments regarding the Natilie Hotel but after staying there for the past week I must say its one of the best weeks stay I have had in a long time, the Hotel staff were always courtious and kind, no problems getting service in the bar, the Hotel and rooms are spotless and 4 elevators available, I stayed on B+B basis and I can assure you the breakfast was a feast, one has two choices, hot or cold buffett, the cold being a selection of fresh fruit segments, variety of cheeses and cold meats etc the hot coice being fried eggs/scrambled, bacon, sausage tomatoes beans and lashings of fresh rolls and toast, the bus station is across the way and train station 5 min. stroll, very handy for visiting/enjoying the Costa, I have nothing but good to say regarding the Natilie and its very polite and helpful staff.

reviews.title: hotel terrible
reviews.text: Would I stay again ?? Yes please, I cant wait to return.

reviews.title: No Regrets!
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in October 2007.

First of all, the worst thing about this hotel is its location. It's in a grotty and rough part of town, on a noisy main road. Impossible to find a parking space if you have a hire car, and no car park.
reviews.title: have no complaints

reviews.text: The hotel rooms were nice and clean as was the dining rooms and reception areas. Meals were the same every day and consisted of a bizarre mixture of squid rings, ham rolls, beef and salad. At breakfast if you are dining between 7 and 730 you may get a fried egg- anything later its a plate of beans, toast or ceral. Bar staff favoured spanish customers, which is fair enough we are vistors in their country. However, in the middle of being served bar staff would walk away and start serving a spanish customers. The hotel is in a residental area, so the main part of the town is an hours walk away. I loved the area- very pretty vibrant spanish town- defintley a different hotel for the next visit.
reviews.title: if your a spanish oap your ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay at the hotel.The hotel is in a ideal position for town centre and public transport.It takes about 15mins. to walk to the sea front via short walk and steps or there is a lift in town centre to use (50 cents each way).The hotel staff were very helpful,room was clean and room service good.The only fault we had in all the 7 days was the food was good but not very hot(buffet style) but there was a microwave there to use. Would go again.
reviews.title: March break

likes.liked: — the position it was in for public transport and cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was great the staff very polite rooms clean, food great we stayed half board plenty to choose from as for the other guests Spanish Oaps found them to be very friendly even made room at their tables for us if no other was available always polite and would greet us with a smile, we have booked to go back next year.
reviews.title: Loved it
worst hotel in spain
reviews.text: this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in.i dont know where to begin. This hotel specialises in spanish oap holidays. So there we were on blackberry week surrounded by 800 spanish pensioners. Not an english person or a kid in sight which didnt go down with my 3 kids very well. The spanish pensioners have to be the rudest in europe and think nothing adout pushing you out of the lift to let yet more oaps in,and the dining hall was just a free for all (all of them anyway). The food was ok but the breakfast was terrible. We lived on bread rolls for a week. The pool was freezing and most of the time not open. All inclusive ends at 11pm sharp so dont dare ask for water at 5 past even if you are a very cute 8 year old as you will not so politely be refused. The only difference between full board and all inc. is the biscuit that you have to ask for at 5pm. This hotel is based in the town and is either a long walk down to the beach or down 200 steps. 800 meters my foot. Our taxi wasnt picking us up until 9 30 pm and a late check out was NOT available nor was a curtesy room so we had to sit in reception from 12 pm until 9 30 pm without a shower ect. THIS HOTEL IS AWFUL IF YOU ARE ENGLISH; A KID; UNDER 80 AND BASICALLY BREATHING: you can keep it i would rather go to butlins and thats saying something.
Arrived 13/10 to a warm welcome in reception,rooms were clean but fairly basic,food in restaurant was not cordon bleu but still edible & fairly tasty,bar staff were friendly & service good.
reviews.title: Cheap & Cheerful

reviews.text: I have just stayed for six nights as a solo traveller at the Hotel Natali on a half board basis and arrived with some trepidation after reading some of the reviews. My experience was actually OK.
reviews.title: Not that bad

likes.disliked: — Could be a bit of a wait for the lifts

reviews.title: its not for the english
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the centre of Torremolinos, just past the bus station. A lot of complaints on this board are over the distance to the beach (about a 15 minute walk) if this is a problem then the answer is simple just choose a hotel on the beach.

The reception area is smart and the staff efficient and polite. The rooms are rather basic but clean with a regular maid servce. Air conditioning was a little on the weak side but at least it was free, as opposed to:
reviews.title: you get what you pay for!!

reviews.text: 3 Euros a day for safe hire
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

likes.liked: — Clean rooms and excellent location from the airport and for shopping.
likes.disliked: — The elevators (which the hotel can do something about) and the other guests (not the hotel's fault!).

reviews.text: 20 Euro deposit for remote control for the tv.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Natali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive:
reviews.title: nasty but cheap

reviews.text: First, it has a good location for persons who are going to travel around Costa del Sol. I mean if you hired a car etc. The bus station is over the hotel. So you can easily reach Malaga or Benalmadena, Fuengirola. If you wish to use a train, remember about undeground RENFE station at the center of the city. Just 10 min away from Natali hotel.
reviews.title: worst holiday hotel ever

reviews.text: The view from our room was pretty good although it's better to choose the sea-view. Or you will see the everydays' life of Torremolinos habitants in the opposite appartmanet block.
reviews.title: only good for a weekend
nightmare holliday
reviews.text: The rooms were clean - they cleaned them up daily.
Negative:
reviews.title: DON'T BE WORRIED
